abstract_summ: Recent evidence indicates that SARS-CoV-2 can cause significant neurological damage and resultant neurological symptoms and complications.We observe that SARS-CoV-2 may have various neurological manifestations and in many cases, neurological features may precede typical respiratory symptoms.We have reviewed original articles, case reports, and existing open-source data-sets to delineate the spectrum of neurological disorders potentially observed in SARS-CoV-2 positive cases.In this article, we review the reports that address neurological manifestations in patients with COVID-19, who may present with acute neurological symptoms (e.g., stroke), even without typical respiratory symptoms such as fever, cough, or shortness of breath.Background: Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), has been associated with many neurological symptoms but there is a little evidence-based published material on the neurological manifestations of COVID-19.
title_summ: A review of pathophysiology and neuropsychiatric manifestations of COVID-19COVID-19, SARS and MERS: A neurological perspectiveNeurological manifestations of COVID-19: a review of what we know so farNeurological Impact of Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19): Practical Considerations for the Neuroscience CommunityNeurological Manifestations of COVID-19 (SARS-CoV-2): A ReviewNeurological Consequences of 2019-nCoV Infection: A Comprehensive Literature ReviewNeurological manifestations and implications of COVID-19 pandemicNeurological manifestations of COVID-19 and other coronaviruses: a systematic reviewCOVID-19 Pandemic: A Neurological PerspectiveThe Neurologic Manifestations of Coronavirus Disease 2019 Pandemic: A Systemic ReviewNeurological manifestations of COVID-19 and other coronavirus infections: A systematic reviewNeurological manifestations associated with COVID-19: a review and a call for actionA complication of coronavirus disease 2019: deliriumThe neurological insights of the emerging coronavirusesNeurological and Psychological Effects of Coronavirus (COVID-19): An Overview of the Current Era PandemicNeurologic Manifestations of Severe Respiratory Viral ContagionsCoronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) From the Point of View of Neurologists: Observation of Neurological Findings and Symptoms During the Combat Against a Pandemic.Neurological manifestations of COVID-19: a systematic reviewNeurobiology of COVID-19.COVID-19 Infection and Neurological Complications: Present Findings and Future Predictions.Neurological manifestations of COVID-19.Emerging evidence for neuropsycho-consequences of COVID-19.Neurologic aspects of covid-19: a concise review.
title_abstract_phrases: We observe that SARS-CoV-2 may have various neurological manifestations and in many cases, neurological features may precede typical respiratory symptoms.The effect on healthcare quality in the field of other neurological diseases is additionally evaluated.Recent evidence indicates that SARS-CoV-2 can cause significant neurological damage and resultant neurological symptoms and complications.We also recommend exploring the risk factors that lead to the development of these neurological manifestations.COVID-19 Pandemic: A Neurological PerspectiveEven though severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) has been observed to principally affect the respiratory system, neurological involvements have already been reported in some published work.
